Package application

Class UI

java.lang.Object
application.UI
public class UI
extends java.lang.Object
The class UI is the user interface of the chess game and it has the purpose of visually presenting the application information, through the terminal
Author:
Jo√£o Victor

    Prints the black and white pieces that were captured in the game.

    It will print the board through the printBoard(ChessPiece[][]) method, the indicator of the pieces captured through the printCapturedPieces(List) method and if there has not been a checkmate (and this will be checked using ChessMatch.getCheckMate()) it will print respectively through the ChessMatch.getTurn() and ChessMatch.getCheck() methods, a message that will say which player is the current turn and also warn if there is a check.

  • Method Details

    • clearScreen

      public static void clearScreen()
      clean the terminal screen

    • readChessPosition

      public static ChessPosition readChessPosition​(java.util.Scanner sc)
      It will allow the program to read a chess position entered by the user
      Returns:
      chess position entered by the user

    • printMatch

      public static void printMatch​(ChessMatch chessMatch, java.util.List<ChessPiece> captured)
      It will print the board through the printBoard(ChessPiece[][]) method, the indicator of the pieces captured through the printCapturedPieces(List) method and if there has not been a checkmate (and this will be checked using ChessMatch.getCheckMate()) it will print respectively through the ChessMatch.getTurn() and ChessMatch.getCheck() methods, a message that will say which player is the current turn and also warn if there is a check. If a checkmate has occurred, it will print a congratulatory message to the winner.
      Parameters:
      chessMatch - a chess match
      captured - list of captured chess pieces

    • printBoard

      public static void printBoard​(ChessPiece[][] piecesMatrix)
      prints on the terminal screen, the matrix of chess pieces passed as method parameter. For each position on the board, a chess piece is printed.
      Parameters:
      piecesMatrix - chess pieces matrix

    • printBoard

      public static void printBoard​(ChessPiece[][] piecesMatrix, boolean[][] possibleMoves)
      prints on the terminal screen, the matrix of chess pieces passed as method parameter, in addition to indication of the possible movements of the movement's source piece.
      Parameters:
      piecesMatrix - chess pieces matrix
      possibleMoves - possible movements of a piece

    • printPiece

      private static void printPiece​(ChessPiece piece, boolean background)
      prints a chess piece. If a board position does not contain a chess piece (that is, the piece is null), then a visual representation for that situation is printed.
      Parameters:
      chessPiece - chess piece
      background - a boolean that if true will paint the background of a chess position

    • printCapturedPieces

      private static void printCapturedPieces​(java.util.List<ChessPiece> capturedPieces)
      Prints the black and white pieces that were captured in the game. For that, this method receives as parameter the list of captured pieces of the game, and then from this list, two new lists are created, the one of captured white pieces and the one of captured black pieces. So these lists are printed when they are converted to Strings by the Object.toString() method
      Parameters:
      capturedPieces - captured pieces list
